et: Latin, in the form of a pauper

dt: {bc}made or carried out in a perfunctory manner or as a formality
{bc}based on financial assumptions or projections: such as
{bc}reflecting a transaction (such as a merger) or other development as if it had been or will be in effect for a past or future period
{bc}excluding usually extraordinary charges or expenses (as from acquisitions, restructuring, or the write-down of goodwill) often in order to present a more attractive financial report

shortdef: made or carried out in a perfunctory manner or as a formality
based on financial assumptions or projections: such as
reflecting a transaction (such as a merger) or other development as if it had been or will be in effect for a past or future period

dt: {bc}a document provided prior to or with a shipment of goods (as for export) that describes the items and terms of sale but does not have the function of a real invoice

shortdef: a document provided prior to or with a shipment of goods (as for export) that describes the items and terms of sale but does not have the function of a real invoice
